text: oh
hi everyone we're kicking off class this
week here the internet's busiest music
nerd and it's time for a classic review
of The Bone Thugs and Harmony album East
1999 Eternal yes this is a review of the
wonderful breakout 1995 album from
Cleveland rap five piece Bone
Thugs-N-Harmony formerly known as bone
Enterprises Bone Thugs owe a lot of
their exposure to a cosine from the one
and only Easy E as he was expanding the
artistic prospects of his ruthless
records label post the demise of NWA and
in my opinion Bone Thugs are handily the
most impactful and significant call Easy
E made in terms of putting anyone on now
Bone Thugs may not have the most
Flawless discography and Hip-Hop but
there are artists who would rightfully
kill to have a record that is half as
impactful or as good as East 1999. it's
dark Eerie production its Relentless
triplet flows its melodic inflections
can all be felt in the current rap
Paradigm from ASAP Mob to Suicide boys
and many many others another thing that
set Bone Thugs apart were just how well
artistically they Blended together as a
group most legendary rap groups and
collectives of the 90s mostly appealed
off of how unique each member was from
the next but busy bone lazy Bone Crazy
Bone Wishbone and flesh and Bone all
reinforce similar Vibes in melodic runs
sometimes layering up as if they were
Hip Hop's answer to a traditional vocal
pop group or something so in that in
many other respects Bone Thugs were
pretty unique but they weren't without
their influences they were at least
partially a product of the G-funk era
they were born out of that is nowhere
more apparent than on their creeping on
a come-up EP but on East 1999 they truly
Hit Upon something that was unique to
them just take a look at the title track
where they have such a dark and twisted
take on that very G-funk genre This
Record also brings tracks that are
Transcendent harmonious and even
otherworldly take for example the song
Eternal or even the existential the
crossroads a song whose music video
haunted me as a kid because of its
surreal use of special effects to
explore loved ones passing on into the
great beyond musically it's a great song
Too blending together seamlessly
elements of Hip-Hop soul r b and gospel
music not to mention the track's really
strong message around mortality other
commercial highlights on this LP include
first of the month a song that also very
much Nails its assignment and create
this inspirational or motivational
Anthem about the fresh beginnings of a
new month a new day a new check the
feel-good Vibes on this one are
undeniable especially with all that
smooth synth work in the production plus
the hypnotizing entrancing refrains that
layer over each other on the chorus wake
up wake up wake up
beyond that though East 1999 is a pretty
dense record with a 68 minute run time
but even the Deep cuts on this thing hit
hard krept and we came wasn't a single
but with one of the catchiest Baseline
and vocal Melody combos in any rap song
I've ever heard it could have easily
been then tracks like the gridian
murderous down 71 die die die or Mr Bill
Collector hit harder than any commercial
highlight here plus the production
brings an almost horror movie twist to
the musical end same with the track land
of the heartless 2 but bone Thug's
Collective flows on this one are so
dizzying intense and fast they weren't
being pointed out specifically even some
of the relative low lights on this thing
are entertaining no shorts no losses
sonically is a lot drier than many of
the other cuts on this LP but it still
brings a good performance to the table
Bud smokers only with the skipping piano
and drum Loops it has a somewhat silly
but still Heavenly Vibe and Buddha
Lovers is a kind of awkward attempt at a
smoker's Anthem where the group really
tests their vocal chops over some slow
jam style production really trying to
pull off a soul style track and uh it's
not quite there but the very blunt and
blunted humor throughout the track kind
of make up for it clearly it's a song
that's not trying to take itself too
seriously
even the interludes on this record
somehow work like me killer for example
which is this acapella group vocal
passage that but honestly shows that
their chemistry is so great an
instrumental isn't entirely needed for a
song to work I just kind of wish this
cut was longer the record also finishes
as strong as it starts to and that among
many other things is why this album is
fantastic it's a classic it's Unique
it's fun it's dark it's emotionally
intense it's passionate it's well
written well sung well performed and
absolutely positively worth your time
Bone Thugs and Harmony East 1999 Eternal
please listen to it amazing record
fantastic record uh bangers on bangers
on bangers with this one and uh yeah
that's it those are my thoughts those
are my feels on this Classic record
transition have you given this album a
listen do you love it do you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
